GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "MOST Manual".
GlobalVariables.redcap:ProjectNotes: Project to demonstrate use of REDCap for MOST studies

ItemGroupDef.Name:
INTRODUCTION

Thank you for agreeing to participate in this interview. We are going to ask you some questions about your health, service use, and how you think about things. Please answer as honestly as you can. We are not here to judge you and what you tell us is confidential. That means we won't tell anyone anything that you say today.

Thank you for agreeing to participate in this project.
We are going to ask you some questions about how you think about things, how you manage some issues, and about your health habits. What you tell us may help us develop better programs and services for others.
We will be talking about some serious issues. To help us understand them, please answer as honestly as you can. We are not here to judge you and what you tell us is confidential. That means we won't tell anyone anything that you say today.
Some of the questions may not apply to you, but it will help us if you try to answer them the best way you can. And, you don't have to answer any question that you don't want to.
First we will get some background information about you.
Over the <u>last 2 weeks</u> how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? <i>(Click the circle to indicate your answer)</u>
Now we are going to ask you about your feelings about some things.

An important part of the project is that we can reach you in the future. In order to do this, we need as much contact information for you as possible, in case anything changes like your phone number or your living situation. So we are asking for your contact information as well as names, addresses and phone numbers of your friends, counselors, doctors, job, or family members - any people in New York or elsewhere - who you have regular contact with and who could help us reach you if necessary. If you don't feel comfortable with us contacting you through a certain person or in a certain way, please don't give us that information . Whenever we try to contact you or any of your contacts, we will just say you are a part of a "community health project" and won't mention any information about you, what the project is about, or the names of any specific agencies in order to protect your confidentiality. Do you have any questions? Now we'll ask you for your contact information and then information for at least 3 other people who, if we can't get in touch with you directly, may be able to help us reach you.
NOTE to Interviewer: Attempt to get three different sources of tracking information
To what extent was the following activity completed?
To what extent was the following activity completed?

ItemDef.Name: scr1_timestamp_auto
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader:
INTRODUCTION

Thank you for agreeing to participate in this interview. We are going to ask you some questions about your health, service use, and how you think about things. Please answer as honestly as you can. We are not here to judge you and what you tell us is confidential. That means we won't tell anyone anything that you say today.

Question.TranslatedText: What is your date of birth?

Where have you been living during the past month, that is, what borough or other location?
NOTE TO INTERVIEWER: "Larger NYC metropolitan area" includes locations that border NYC in Nassau County Long Island, and counties in North-East New Jersey on the Hudson River including Middlesex, Union, Essex, Hudson, and Bergen counties
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Where have you been living during the past month, that is, what borough or other location?

NOTE TO INTERVIEWER:
"Larger NYC metropolitan area" includes locations that border NYC in Nassau County Long Island, and counties in North-East New Jersey on the Hudson River including Middlesex, Union, Essex, Hudson, and Bergen counties

Question.TranslatedText: Do you have any plans to leave the New York City metropolitan area in the next year?

Participant is
INELIGIBLE
That's the end of the interview. Thank you so much for your time, and for telling us about yourself. You are Not Eligible for the other part of the study.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Participant is

INELIGIBLE

That's the end of the interview. Thank you so much for your time, and for telling us about yourself. You are Not Eligible for the other part of the study.

Question.TranslatedText: PLEASE CHECK THE ELIGIBILITY STATUS - THE PARTICIPANT SHOULD BE ELIGIBLE
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: PLEASE CHECK THE ELIGIBILITY STATUS - THE PARTICIPANT SHOULD BE ELIGIBLE

Question.TranslatedText: PLEASE CHECK THE ELIGIBILITY STATUS - THE PARTICIPANT SHOULD BE INELIGIBLE
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: PLEASE CHECK THE ELIGIBILITY STATUS - THE PARTICIPANT SHOULD BE INELIGIBLE

Question.TranslatedText:
That's the end of the interview. Thank you so much for your time, and for telling us about yourself.
You are eligible for another part of the study, and I will explain what that involves next.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
That's the end of the interview.
Thank you so much for your time, and for telling us about yourself.

You are eligible for another part of the study, and I will explain what that involves next.

ItemDef.Name: bl_timestamp_auto
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader:
Thank you for agreeing to participate in this project.
We are going to ask you some questions about how you think about things, how you manage some issues, and about your health habits. What you tell us may help us develop better programs and services for others.
We will be talking about some serious issues. To help us understand them, please answer as honestly as you can. We are not here to judge you and what you tell us is confidential. That means we won't tell anyone anything that you say today.
Some of the questions may not apply to you, but it will help us if you try to answer them the best way you can. And, you don't have to answer any question that you don't want to.
First we will get some background information about you.

Question.TranslatedText:
What is your date of birth?
Interviewer
Explain to participant how to input dates by typing it in, or using the calendar icon to select the date.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
What is your date of birth?

Interviewer

Explain to participant how to input dates by typing it in, or using the calendar icon to select the date.

Question.TranslatedText: How religious or spiritual do you consider yourself to be?
What is the highest level of education you have completed?

ItemDef.Name: phq9_1
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader: Over the <u>last 2 weeks</u> how often have you been bothered by any of the following problems? <i>(Click the circle to indicate your answer)</u>

Question.TranslatedText: 1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things
3. Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
4. Feeling tired or having little energy
6. Feeling bad about yourself -- or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
7. Trouble concentrating on things, such as reading the newspaper or watching television
8. Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or the opposite -- being so fidgety or restless that you have been moving around a lot more than usual
9. Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way
If you checked off any problems, how difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: If you checked off <u>any</u> problems, how <u>difficult </u> have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?

Question.TranslatedText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?

Question.TranslatedText: Feeling nervous, anxious or on edge.
Not being able to stop or control worrying.
Worrying too much about different things.

ItemDef.Name: gad_q5
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader: Now we are going to ask you about your feelings about some things.

Question.TranslatedText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: Over the last 2 weeks, how often have you been bothered by the following problems?

Question.TranslatedText: Being so restless that it is hard to sit still.
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen.
If you checked off any problems, how difficult have these problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people?
How much did you like this video?
What did you think about the length of this video?
How much did you like this video?
What did you think about the length of this video?
How effective was the group leader?
Did you read the text message?

ItemDef.Name: loc_date
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader:
An important part of the project is that we can reach you in the future. In order to do this, we need as much contact information for you as possible, in case anything changes like your phone number or your living situation. So we are asking for your contact information as well as names, addresses and phone numbers of your friends, counselors, doctors, job, or family members - any people in New York or elsewhere - who you have regular contact with and who could help us reach you if necessary. If you don't feel comfortable with us contacting you through a certain person or in a certain way, please don't give us that information . Whenever we try to contact you or any of your contacts, we will just say you are a part of a "community health project" and won't mention any information about you, what the project is about, or the names of any specific agencies in order to protect your confidentiality. Do you have any questions? Now we'll ask you for your contact information and then information for at least 3 other people who, if we can't get in touch with you directly, may be able to help us reach you.
NOTE to Interviewer: Attempt to get three different sources of tracking information

Question.TranslatedText:
Date of Locator form update
(Update this date every time Locator form is updated)
What is you current cell phone number?
DO NOT change the auto-filled response.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: DO NOT change the auto-filled response.

ItemDef.Name: core_activity1
ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader: To what extent was the following activity completed?

Question.TranslatedText: Provide reason for the activity not being completed.

ItemDef.redcap:SectionHeader: To what extent was the following activity completed?

Question.TranslatedText: Provide reason for the activity not being completed.
What went well during the encounter?
What challenges came up during the encounter? (include issues you would like to cover in supervision):

What challenges came up during the encounter?
(include issues you would like to cover in supervision):

Question.TranslatedText:
You are currently in the WRONG study arm.
Go to the Randomization Form, and check the correct study condition.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: You are currently in the WRONG study arm. Go to the Randomization Form, and check the correct study condition.

ItemDef.Name: scond_check_notif_correct
ItemDef.redcap:BranchingLogic: (([randomization_arm_2][rand_scond] = '3') and [check_staff_rcond] = '3') or (([randomization_arm_2][rand_scond] = '4') and [check_staff_rcond] = '4') or (([randomization_arm_2][rand_scond] = '5') and [check_staff_rcond] = '5') or (([randomization_arm_2][rand_scond] = '6') and [check_staff_rcond] = '6') or (([randomization_arm_2][rand_scond] = '7') and [check_staff_rcond] = '7') or (([randomization_arm_2][rand_scond] = '8') and [check_staff_rcond] = '8') or (([randomization_arm_2][rand_scond] = '9') and [check_staff_rcond] = '9') or (([randomization_arm_2][rand_scond] = '10') and [check_staff_rcond] = '10')

Question.TranslatedText: You are currently in the CORRECT study arm.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: You are currently in the CORRECT study arm.

Decode.TranslatedText: Middle School (Junior High School or less)
